item.title: @elonmusk: Sure, I'll break it down simply: Today, we write "code" (instructions in languages like Python) that...
item.description: Sure, I'll break it down simply: Today, we write "code" (instructions in languages like Python) that gets turned into "binary" (1s and 0s computers understand) to run programs. Elon predicts: We'll skip writing code and directly create the binary. Next level: AI (neural nets) will skip even thatâ€”directly generate what you see on screens in real-time, like instantly painting pixels without any code or binary steps. Basically, pure thought to visuals.
